result.execSummary:
The defendant Allison N. Peot was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
On Count #1, the Court sentences Miss Peot to 4 and 1 half years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 years. This sentence is to commence consecutive to that which the Defendant is currently serving 

****PER 3-10-2016 COURT ORDER - JOC is Amended to reflect 2 Years Extended Supervision not 3 *****

superMiscConds.notes:
--To pay costs of $268

--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge

--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription

--No contact with Nicole Tasker, Jonathan Rusch, Benjamin Harmon or Keith Lueloff

--No possession of any hypodermic needles unless medically necessary and expressly approved by the agent

--No presence at the Hilltop Motel

--No Contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent

--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

--AODA Assessment & Follow-through with any recommended treatment, per Agent

--To submit to any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as per Agent

--Random drug and/or alcohol screening
 at least once per month for first six months upon release from prison and otherwise deemed appropriate per Agent

--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or make legitimate efforts to obtain employment

Arresting Agency: JCSD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt: with criminal case settlement and elements

Case called at 9:12 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for FSSC)
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Allison N. Peot in court, in-custody, with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ files AMENDED information; Service of the amended information admitted; reading waived

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds the Defendant  guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2

On Count #1, the Court sentences Miss Peot to 4 and 1 half years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 years. This sentence is to commence consecutive to that which the Defendant is currently serving 

The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court gives 0 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--AODA Assessment & Follow-through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To submit to any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as per Agent
--Random drug and/or alcohol screening at least once per month for first six months upon release from prison and otherwise deemed appropriate per Agent
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or make legitimate efforts to obtain employment
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--No contact with Nicole Tasker, Jonathan Rusch, Benjamin Harmon or Keith Lueloff
--No possession of any hypodermic needles unless medically necessary and expressly approved by the agent
--No presence at the Hilltop Motel
--Perform 50 hours of community service designed to educate the youth and the public about the dangers and availability of opiates
--No Contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent
--To pay costs of $268
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
--To pay $25 drug testing fee

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
Recess: 9:52 am

Case called at 1:21 pm [sf]
Defendant Allison N. Peot in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney De La Rosa advises the defendant qualifies for SPD representation.
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Address and DOB information verified or DOB verified. 
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $500.00 CASH bond, with conditions: 
-No possession or consumption of any controlled substances without a valid   
  prescription
-Take prescribed medications as prescribed
-Not to poossess any hypodermic needles except for medical purposes 
-No contact with Keith Lueloff, Nicole Tasker, Jonathan Rusch or Benjamin Harmon
